title: Billie Holiday - Lady in Satin (1958) RESEED
description:
MP3/256Kbps

A harrowing classic, Billie Holiday&#039;s personal favorite among her &#039;50s albums captures the singer 17 months before her death, her once honeyed voice, scarred and weakened from punishing life, its ravages highlighted by the 1958 session&#039;s crisp sonics and the contrasting "satin" of Ray Ellis&#039; sleek string arrangements. Yet it is that very contrast that explains the power of these performances: In revisiting its torchy standards, Holiday reduces them to their core of pain and longing, transforming "I&#039;m a Fool to Want You," "You Don&#039;t Know What Love Is," and "You&#039;ve Changed" into naked declarations as mesmerizing and unsettling as a horrific accident. Any postrocker that presumes pop standards and string sections automatically translate to "easy listening" hasn&#039;t listened to this. 

Track listing:
   1. "I&#039;m a Fool to Want You" (Joel Herron, Frank Sinatra, Jack Wolf) ? 3:23
   2. "For Heaven&#039;s Sake" (Elise Bretton, Sherman Edwards, Donald Meyer) ? 3:26
   3. "You Don&#039;t Know What Love Is" (Gene DePaul, Don Raye) ? 3:48
   4. "I Get Along Without You Very Well" (Hoagy Carmichael) ? 2:59
   5. "For All We Know" (J. Fred Coots, Sam M. Lewis) ? 2:53
   6. "Violets for Your Furs" (Tom Adair, Matt Dennis) ? 3:24
   7. "You&#039;ve Changed" (Bill Carey, Carl Fischer) ? 3:17
   8. "It&#039;s Easy to Remember" (Lorenz Hart, Richard Rodgers) ? 4:01
   9. "But Beautiful" (w. Johnny Burke, m. Jimmy Van Heusen) ? 4:29
  10. "Glad to Be Unhappy" (Lorenz Hart, Richard Rodgers) ? 4:07
  11. "I&#039;ll Be Around" (Alec Wilder) ? 3:23
  12. "The End of a Love Affair" [Mono Version] (Edward Redding) ? 4:46
